{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3132613,"name":"Jim Shanley","username":"jhshanley","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/45deac/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-23T22:52:14.565Z","cooked":"

Has anyone evaluated the use of a pneumatic angular gripper? Something similar to Nitra model KA32MSA-M as available on Automation Direct?

Certainly seems easy to integrate into FRC pneumatics systems but question is would it have enough grip force to pick up a cone?

Cube seems easier due to it being lighter and more compliant.

Rather not drop the $200 if someone tells me to keep looking.

Thanks for the help!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-01-23T22:52:14.565Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":58,"reads":285,"readers_count":284,"score":362.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":424475,"topic_slug":"pneumatic-cots-gripper","display_username":"Jim Shanley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43666,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 7694"},"post_url":"/t/pneumatic-cots-gripper/424475/1","custom_user_title":"Mentor 7694","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3132621,"name":"Luin","username":"LuiTheFly","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/luithefly/{size}/175341_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-23T23:17:44.202Z","cooked":"

IMHO (for that particular part number) it looks way too small to be useful for this season, especially at that price.
Maybe one year there will be a gamepiece that it would be good for, but I dont think this is that year.

To me, the use case for it would be grabbing a cone by the bottom lip.
A whole bunch of teams have shown, you can achieve the same results with 2 counter rotating 2" wheels for a fraction of the cost and you can add more wheels to an axle to have a wider intake area than just one of those pneumatic grippers.

Thanks for the feedback. Your impressions are similar to mine. My team is not great at design so the COTS was attractive.

I think there are better solutions to the game than a pneumatic gripper.

That said, if that is your strategy, you may want to consider the GreyT Roller Claw.
